text: Hey Dhruvin hows things? You still really busy with school work? Let me know if there'e anything you want to ask me or find out about from the working world, going to uni, interviews etc etc

So recently we've been talking to a lot of employers to take on their feedback and understand what they want. We've been having lots of phone call interviews with people we messaged cold through Linkedin!
Generally I find the best way to approach people when you want something from them is to ask for help genuinely and openly. You will be surprised how many people want to help others.
Then once you get on a call with them you can open them up and build a relationship

It's also the case that generally you shouldn't go to someone asking for something on your first call/meeting, but that you build up a relationship over a couple of meetings (if possible) before you do. That is what networking is all about, you don't necessarily see the rewards of it straight away.
